turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about RDE-1.
turn.1: What is the function of RDE-1?
turn.2: RDE-1  RDE-1 ("R"NAi-"DE"fective "1") is a primary Argonaute protein required for RNA-mediated interference (RNAi) in "Caenorhabditis elegans".
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The rde-1 gene locus was first characterized in "C. elegans" mutants resistant to RNAi, and is a member of a highly conserved Piwi gene family that includes plant, Drosophila, and vertebrate homologs.
turn.5: What does it do inside the cell?
turn.6: Upon uptake into the cell, exogenous trigger dsRNA is bound by RDE-4 and cleaved into 21-25nt primary siRNA by a Dicer complex that includes RDE-1.
turn.8: Primary siRNA binding to RDE-1 then promotes the formation of the RNA-induced silencing complex (RISC).
turn.9: Is there anything else noteworthy about its function?
turn.10: Unlike in other Argonautes characterized in Drosophila and humans, the catalytic RNase H motif in RDE-1 has not been shown to exhibit Slicer activity of the target transcript.
turn.11: Why doesn't it have that activity?
turn.12: Instead, RNase H activity in RDE-1 is primarily facilitates siRNA maturation through cleavage of the passenger strand.
